intro: Arrhostoxylum costatum, commonly known as the Andean thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are usually narrow and leathery. It is characterized by its thorny stems and is adapted to the harsh, cold climates of its native habitat. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations and potential ecological importance in its ecosystem.
